(2) An object placed at 15 cm on the axis on the convex side of silvered plano-convex lens gives rise to an image at a distance of 30 cm from it
(3) An object placed at a distance of 20 cm on the axis on the convex side of silvered plano-convex lens gives rise to an image at 40 cm from it
(4) Silvered plano-convex lens acts as a concave mirror of focal length 10 cm.

question: A linear object of size 1.5 cm placed at 10 cm from a lens of focal length 20 cm. The optic centre of lens and the object are displaced a distance Δ = 5cm. The magnification of the image formed is m (Take optic centre as origin). The coordinates of image of A and B are (x₁, y₁) and (x₂, y₂) respectively. Then

A combination of two thin convex lenses of equal focal lengths, is kept separated along the optical axis by a distance of 20 cm between them. The combination behaves as a lens system of infinite focal length,
options: (1) if an object is kept on the common optic axis at a distance of 10 cm from the first lens, its final image will be formed at a distance of 10 cm from the next lens.
(2) if an object is kept on the common optic axis at a distance of 10 cm from the first lens, its final image will be formed at a distance of 30 cm from the next lens.
(3) if an object is kept on the common optic axis at a distance of 30 cm from the first lens, its final image will be formed at a distance of 10 cm from the next lens.
(4) if an object is kept on the common optic axis at a distance of 30 cm from the first lens, its final image will be formed at a distance of 20 cm from the next lens.

question: A parallel beam of light is incident on a lens of focal length 10 cm. A parallel slab of refractive index 1.5 and thickness 3 cm is placed on the other side of the lens. The nature of the final image from the lens slab combination is (Assume rays to be paraxial)
options: (1) at distance of 11 cm and image is virtual if x = 12 cm.
(2) at distance of 11 cm and image is real if x = 14 cm.
(3) at the distance of 11 cm and image is virtual if x = 16 cm.
(4) at distance of 11 cm and image is real if x = 5 cm.

question: An upright object is placed at a distance in front of a converging lens equal to twice the focal length 20 cm of the lens. On the other side there is a concave mirror of focal length 15 cm separated from the lens by a distance of 70 cm. Then select the correct statements from the following (object distance 40cm)
options: (3) Final image by the system will real and at distance of 110 cm from spherical mirror

question: A convex lens forms inverted image of a real object on a fixed screen. The size of image is 12 cm When lens is displaced 20 cm along principal axis it again forms a real image of size 3 cm on the screen. Choose the correct options. (Assume image formation only by paraxial rays)
options: (1) Focal length of the lens is 40/3 cm
(2) Focal length of the lens is 80/3 cm

question: Two converging lenses have focal length f₁ and f₂ (f₁ > f₂). The optical axis of the two lenses coincide. This lens system is used to form an image of real object. It is observed that final magnification of the image does not depend on the distance x. Whole arrangement is shown in figure. Choose the correct options.
options: (3) Distance between the lenses is f₁f₂ / (f₁ + f₂)
(4) Distance between the lenses is f₁ + f₂

question: A plano-convex lens is made of a material of refractive index n. When a small object is placed 30 cm away from the curved surface of the lens, an image of double the size of the object is produced. Due to reflection from the convex surface of the lens, another faint image is observed at a distance of 10 cm away from the lens. Which of the following statement (s) is(are) true?
options: (1) The refractive index of the lens is 2.5.
(2) The radius of curvature of the convex surface is 45 cm.
(3) The faint image is erect and real.
(4) The focal length of the lens is 20 cm.

question: A point source of light S is placed on the axis of a lens of focal length 20 cm as shown (S at 25cm from lens). A screen is placed normal to the axis of lens at a distance x from it. Treat all rays as paraxial. Mark the correct statements.
options: (1) As x is increased from zero, intensity continuously decreases.
(2) As x is increased from zero, intensity first increases and then decreases.
(3) Intensity at centre of screen for x = 90 cm and x = 110 cm is same.
(4) Radius of bright circle obtained on screen is equal to 1 cm for x = 200 cm.

question: In the figure shown a point object O is placed in air on the principal axis. The radius of curvature of the spherical surface is 60 cm. I₁ is the final image formed after all the refractions and reflections. (ng = 3/2, water surrounding part of sphere, d1, d2 specified)
options: (1) If d₁ = 120 cm, then 'I₁' is formed on 'O' for any value of d₂.
(2) If d₁ = 240 cm, then 'I₁' is formed on 'O' only if d₂ = 360 cm.
(3) If d₁ = 240 cm, then 'I₁' is formed on 'O' for all values of d₂.
(4) If d₁ = 240 cm, then 'I₁' cannot be formed on 'O'.

question: Two refracting media are separated by a spherical interface as shown in the figure. PP' is the principal axis, μ₁ and μ₂ are the refractive indices of medium of incidence and medium of refraction respectively. If
options: (1) μ₂ > μ₁, there cannot be a real image of real object.
(2) μ₂ > μ₁, there cannot be a real image of virtual object.
(3) μ₁ > μ₂, there cannot be a virtual image of virtual object.
(4) μ₁ > μ₂, there cannot be a real image of real object.

question: A luminous point object is placed at O, whose image is formed at I as shown in the figure. AB is the optical axis. Which of the following statements are correct?
options: (1) If a lens is used to obtain an image, the lens must be converging.
(2) If a mirror is used to obtain an image, the mirror must be a convex mirror having pole at the point of intersection of lines OI and AB.
(3) Position of principal focus of mirror cannot be found.

question: A convex lens is placed in the XYZ coordinate system such that its optical centre is at the origin and principal axis is along the x-axis. The focal length of the lens is 20 cm. A point object has been placed at the point (-40 cm, +1 cm, -1 cm). Which of the following are correct about coordinates of the image?

options: (1) The distance between the two positions of the lens is 30 cm.
(2) The distance of the object from the lens in its first position is 36 cm.
(3) The height of the object is 6 cm.

question: An object O is kept in front of a converging lens of focal length 30 cm behind which there is a plane mirror at 15 cm from the lens. Choose the correct statements. (Object at 15cm from lens)
options: (1) The final image is formed at 60 cm from the lens towards right of it.
(2) The final image is at 60 cm from lens towards left of it.
